name: Alcoholic
description: The aroma, flavor, and warming effect of ethanol and higher alcohols. Sometimes described as hot.

name: Astringent
description: Puckering, lingering harshness and/or dryness in the finish/aftertaste; harsh graininess; huskiness.

name: Diacetyl
description: Artificial butter, butterscotch, or toffee aroma and flavor. Sometimes perceived as a slickness on the tongue.

name: DMS (dimethyl sulfide)
description: At low levels a sweet, cooked or canned corn-like aroma and flavor.

name: Estery
description: Aroma and/or flavor of any ester (fruits, fruit flavorings, or roses).

name: Grassy
description: Aroma/flavor of fresh-cut grass or green leaves.

name: Light-Struck
description: Similar to the aroma of a skunk.

name: Metallic
description: Tinny, coiny, copper, iron, or blood-like flavor.

name: Oxidized
description: Any one or combination of stale, winy/vinous, cardboard, papery, or sherry-like aromas and flavors.

name: Phenolic
description: Spicy (clove, pepper), smoky, plastic, plastic adhesive strip, and/or medicinal (chlorophenolic).

name: Solvent
description: Aromas and flavors of higher alcohols (fusel alcohols). Similar to acetone or lacquer thinner aromas.

name: Sour/Acidic
description: Tartness in aroma and flavor. Can be sharp and clean (lactic acid), or vinegar-like (acetic acid).

name: Sulfur
description: The aroma of rotten eggs or burning matches.

name: Vegetal
description: Cooked, canned, or rotten vegetable aroma and flavor (cabbage, onion, celery, asparagus, etc.)

name: Yeasty
description: A bready, sulfury or yeast-like aroma or flavor.
